item.title: Mining Bitcoins Is A Surprisingly Energy-Intensive Endeavor
item.description:
Mining Bitcoins Is A Surprisingly Energy-Intensive Endeavor

Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are growing in importance and rely on supercomputers and lots of electrons for their creation. If they become a truly vital sector of the economy, they will draw substantial amounts of electricity in low-cost power markets across the globe.

item.title: Zurich Falls Behind in Bitcoin Adoption and Fintech Development - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Zurich Falls Behind in Bitcoin Adoption and Fintech Development - NEWSBTC

Zurich doesn't have any intention of promoting the use of Bitcoin and other digital currencies in the world, says the City Council. All places aren't made equal, the same holds good for governments too, especially when it comes to Bitcoin and other digital currencies.

item.title: Why Ethereum Succeeded Where Bitcoin Failed
item.description:
Why Ethereum Succeeded Where Bitcoin Failed

Imagine that tomorrow you wake up and discover that you've been taken for all you're worth by an anonymous hacker. The thief has managed to steal everything that belonged to you and a good deal of others-$56 million worth of a new virtual currency that you've invested in, to be exact.

item.title: Why Bitcoin's 'Nervous System' is Getting an Upgrade - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why Bitcoin's 'Nervous System' is Getting an Upgrade - CoinDesk

A long-running effort to increase the time in which data for bitcoin's transaction blocks around the world has received an upgrade. Since bitcoin was released, an array of services or solutions have emerged to meet the needs of those using the digital currency.

item.title: 1st Bitcoin Securities Fraud Case Ends in 18-Month Sentence
item.description:
1st Bitcoin Securities Fraud Case Ends in 18-Month Sentence

A Texas man has been sentenced to 18 months in prison for carrying out what prosecutors said was the first bitcoin securities fraud case. Trendon Shavers was sentenced Thursday in Manhattan federal court. Judge Lewis Kaplan said Shavers committed a serious crime but had earned leniency...

item.title: Tumbling Bitcoins: A Guide Through the Rinse Cycle - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Tumbling Bitcoins: A Guide Through the Rinse Cycle - Bitcoin News

When it comes to Bitcoin, privacy is a big deal to a lot of people, and it might be because they are partaking in a type of exchange that their government doesn't agree with. It also might be because certain Bitcoin-related businesses may blacklist you due to using gambling sites.

A Texas man has been sentenced to 18 months in prison for carrying out what prosecutors said was the first bitcoin securities fraud case.

item.title: Texan gets 1-1/2 years in prison for running bitcoin Ponzi scheme
item.description:
Texan gets 1-1/2 years in prison for running bitcoin Ponzi scheme

NEW YORK A Texas man was sentenced to 1-1/2 years in prison on Thursday for operating a bitcoin-related Ponzi scheme that prosecutors say resulted in the first U.S. criminal securities fraud case related to the digital currency. Trendon Shavers, who operated Bitcoin Savings and Trust, was also ordered by U.S.
